entry.title: The Land - A (Stretched) Burning Ship Fractal Zoom

media:group.media:title: The Land - A (Stretched) Burning Ship Fractal Zoom
media:group.media:description:
You are looking at the Burning Ship fractal, except it is very very stretched, skewed and rotated. Stretching certain areas of the Burning Ship reveals interesting Mandelbrot like features that have been hidden. I've also used a bit of noise-based creative colouring in this one. This video is full of Earth colours.
This video is running at half the usual speed because otherwise YouTube compression would destroy it. It is kind of relaxing this way though. Put this one on your TV and let it roll away in the background.
If you like this kind of thing, then let me know.
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon. I'll have the high quality downloads available for you shortly.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown

media:group.media:title: Sunset Buffalo - Buffalo Fractal Zoom
media:group.media:description:
Today we have just a simple Buffalo Fractal zoom with traditional escape time colouring. I haven't explored this fractal much on this channel, so I thought it might be nice to make a video with simple colouring so that people can get a feel for some of the structures within it.
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown

media:group.media:title: Spires - Burning Ship Fractal Zoom
media:group.media:description:
A zoom into the spires of the Burning Ship fractal. The colouring is quite steady early in the video, but the colour scheme evolves later in the video as the iteration density increases. Enjoy!

entry.title: The Hardest Trip II - 100,000 Subscriber Special

media:group.media:title: The Hardest Trip II - 100,000 Subscriber Special
media:group.media:description:
To celebrate reaching 100,000 subscribers I've tried to make a sequel to the most popular video on Maths Town: "The Hardest Trip". Same colouring, same music artist, a bit deeper, and a few less iterations.
Thanks to everyone who has supported the channel over the last few year. 100,000 subscribers is a huge milestone for such a niche channel! Your support is most appreciated!
As usual, presented with mid-roll ads disabled so you can simply enjoy.
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown

media:group.media:title: Deepish - Mandelbrot Fractal Zoom (e2656) (4k 60fps)
media:group.media:description:
A deep zoom all the way to a magnification of 4e2656 (that is 4 with 2656 zeros after it). Imagine if your camera could do that! A clasic colouring and some trap sounds from "Damma Beatz" for this zoom. It's a long one so if you don't enjoy my music selection, play something of your own.
As usual, I have disabled mid-roll ads, so you can enjoy this 3 hour zoom uninterupted.
All these infinite shapes and patterns are created simply by calculating the equation "z=z²+c" over and over again. How such a simple equation creates such intricate shapes is one of the many wonders of the mathematical world.
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown

entry.title: Neon Oblivion - A Mandelbrot Fractal Mini-Zoom

media:group.media:title: Neon Oblivion - A Mandelbrot Fractal Mini-Zoom
media:group.media:description:
Something a little different today. A dark experimental zoom into the Neon Oblivion. The shapes are based on a colouring technique known as the Triangle Inequality Average. This one is probably not suitable if you are senstitive to flashing light. (Please view at high-resolution)
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown

entry.title: Infinite Relaxation [Part 2] - A Mandelbrot Fractal Zoom (3e3284)

media:group.media:title: Infinite Relaxation [Part 2] - A Mandelbrot Fractal Zoom (3e3284)
media:group.media:description:
A relaxing full colour 4-hour journey into the deep depths of the Mandelbrot. This is now the deepest zoom on this channel, going to a magnifiction of 3e3284. That is 3 with 3284 zeros after it! (Try zooming in that far on your phone).
This zoom uses a very classic colouring method and the pallette covers the full spectrum. This video seems to look best at the 4k setting (even though there is higher resolutions available, it was uploaded at 6k).
It is possible to present this video with NO mid-roll ads thanks to Patreons supporters, and NFT buyers. So releax and enjoy.
Due to YouTube's 100gb file size restriction, this video is uploaded in two parts. Part 1: https://youtu.be/6ouG6L-2L3Q
Thank-you to my supporters on Patreon.
This video will be available for Patreons to download in the coming days, which will have a higher bitrate. You can also use these visuals on your own channel if you are a member of my Patreon page. https://www.patreon.com/mathstown
